alert.note: Alert for Avery; Buncombe; Graham; Haywood; Madison; Mitchell; Swain; Yancey (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 27 at 3:49AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...SPOTTY LIGHT ICE AND SNOW ACCUMULATION POSSIBLE AROUND DAYBREAK IN HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF THE NORTH CAROLINA MOUNTAINS... A cold front has passed the southern Appalachians and temperatures are expected to fall quickly this morning in higher elevations of the North Carolina mountains. Precipitation will remain possible through mid-morning, although becoming increasingly light with time. Where temperatures fall below freezing, the precipitation may fall as light snow, with northwest-facing slopes also likely to see a minimal amount of ice accumulation. At some locations above 3500 feet, and possibly in some lower valley locations along the Tennessee border, this could result in bridges and decks becoming slippery. Sunshine will return by late morning and temperatures will rise above freezing by midday at all but the highest ridge tops.

area.areaDesc: Avery; Buncombe; Graham; Haywood; Madison; Mitchell; Swain; Yancey
